comments: With a different offset, number of n-permutations (n>=9) of 5 objects: u, v, z, x, y with repetition allowed, containing exactly nine (9) u's. - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jul 02 2008
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..400
prog: (Sage) [lucas_number2(n, 4, 0)*binomial(n,9)/2^18 for n in xrange(9, 26)]# [From _Zerinvary Lajos_, Mar 11 2009](MAGMA) [4^n*Binomial(n+9, 9): n in [0..30]]; // Vincenzo Librandi, Oct 15 2011
author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Mar 13 2000
